Description: Egyptian blue scarab, badly corroded, pierced lengthwise, with striated legs, and base decorated by an illegible inscription.
Curator's comments: One of the "two blue paste scarabs (...) the only representative at Defenneh of the great class of Naukratite scarabs" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 73 § 70, pl. xli, 69. The other one must be London, BM, EA 35634.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 73 § 70, pl. xli, 69)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.65, p.181, pl.23)
